A list of one or many input items to the model, containing different content types.

input.description: Text, image, or file inputs to the model, used to generate a response.

include.description:
Specify additional output data to include in the model response. Currently supported values are:
    - code_interpreter_call.outputs: Includes the outputs of python code execution in code interpreter tool call items.
    - computer_call_output.output.image_url: Include image urls from the computer call output.
    - file_search_call.results: Include the search results of the file search tool call.
    - message.output_text.logprobs: Include logprobs with assistant messages.
    - reasoning.encrypted_content: Includes an encrypted version of reasoning tokens in reasoning item outputs. This enables reasoning items to be used in multi-turn conversations when using the Responses API statelessly (like when the store parameter is set to false, or when an organization is enrolled in the zero data retention program).

instructions.description:
A system (or developer) message inserted into the model's context.

When using along with previous_response_id, the instructions from a previous response will not be carried over to the next response. This makes it simple to swap out system (or developer) messages in new responses.

max_output_tokens.description: An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a response, including visible output tokens and reasoning tokens.

metadata.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard.

Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum length of 512 characters.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run tool calls in parallel.

previous_response_id.description: The unique ID of the previous response to the model. Use this to create multi-turn conversations.

id.description: The unique identifier of the prompt template to use.

variables.description: Optional map of values to substitute in for variables in your prompt. The substitution values can either be strings, or other Response input types like images or files.

version.description: Optional version of the prompt template.

prompt.description: Reference to a prompt template and its variables.

effort.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

summary.description: A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process.

reasoning.description:
o-series models only
Configuration options for reasoning models.

store.description: Whether to store the generated model response for later retrieval via API.

stream.description: If set to true, the model response data will be streamed to the client as it is generated using server-sent events.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always text.

anyOf.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always json_object.

anyOf.description: An older method of generating JSON responses. Using json_schema is recommended for models that support it. Note that the model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it to do so.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output. If set to True, the model will always follow the exact schema defined in the schema field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when strict is True.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

anyOf.description: JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.

format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output.

text.description: Configuration options for a text response from the model. Can be plain text or structured JSON data.

anyOf.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.

none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.

auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools.

required means the model must call one or more tools.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

truncation.description:
The truncation strategy to use for the model response.

    - auto: If the context of this response and previous ones exceeds the model's context window size, the model will truncate the response to fit the context window by dropping input items in the middle of the conversation.
    - disabled (default): If a model response will exceed the context window size for a model, the request will fail with a 400 error.

A list of one or many input items to the model, containing different content types.

input.description: Text, image, or file inputs to the model, used to generate a response.

include.description:
Specify additional output data to include in the model response. Currently supported values are:
    - code_interpreter_call.outputs: Includes the outputs of python code execution in code interpreter tool call items.
    - computer_call_output.output.image_url: Include image urls from the computer call output.
    - file_search_call.results: Include the search results of the file search tool call.
    - message.output_text.logprobs: Include logprobs with assistant messages.
    - reasoning.encrypted_content: Includes an encrypted version of reasoning tokens in reasoning item outputs. This enables reasoning items to be used in multi-turn conversations when using the Responses API statelessly (like when the store parameter is set to false, or when an organization is enrolled in the zero data retention program).

instructions.description:
A system (or developer) message inserted into the model's context.

When using along with previous_response_id, the instructions from a previous response will not be carried over to the next response. This makes it simple to swap out system (or developer) messages in new responses.

max_output_tokens.description: An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a response, including visible output tokens and reasoning tokens.

metadata.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard.

Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings with a maximum length of 512 characters.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to allow the model to run tool calls in parallel.

previous_response_id.description: The unique ID of the previous response to the model. Use this to create multi-turn conversations.

id.description: The unique identifier of the prompt template to use.

variables.description: Optional map of values to substitute in for variables in your prompt. The substitution values can either be strings, or other Response input types like images or files.

version.description: Optional version of the prompt template.

prompt.description: Reference to a prompt template and its variables.

effort.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

summary.description: A summary of the reasoning performed by the model. This can be useful for debugging and understanding the model's reasoning process.

reasoning.description:
o-series models only
Configuration options for reasoning models.

store.description: Whether to store the generated model response for later retrieval via API.

stream.description: If set to true, the model response data will be streamed to the client as it is generated using server-sent events.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always text.

anyOf.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always json_object.

anyOf.description: An older method of generating JSON responses. Using json_schema is recommended for models that support it. Note that the model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it to do so.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output. If set to True, the model will always follow the exact schema defined in the schema field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when strict is True.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

anyOf.description: JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.

format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output.

text.description: Configuration options for a text response from the model. Can be plain text or structured JSON data.

anyOf.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model.

none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message.

auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools.

required means the model must call one or more tools.
Indicates that the model should use a built-in tool to generate a response.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

type.description: For function calling, the type is always function.

tool_choice.description: How the model should select which tool (or tools) to use when generating a response.

type.description: The type of the web search tool. One of web_search_preview or web_search_preview_2025_03_11.

search_context_size.description: High level guidance for the amount of context window space to use for the search. One of low, medium, or high. medium is the default.

type.description: The type of location approximation. Always approximate.

city.description: Free text input for the city of the user, e.g. San Francisco.

country.description: The two-letter ISO country code of the user, e.g. US.

region.description: Free text input for the region of the user, e.g. California.

timezone.description: The IANA timezone of the user, e.g. America/Los_Angeles.

anyOf.description: This tool searches the web for relevant results to use in a response.

display_height.description: The height of the computer display.

display_width.description: The width of the computer display.

environment.description: The type of computer environment to control.

type.description: The type of the computer use tool. Always computer_use_preview.

anyOf.description: A tool that controls a virtual computer.

server_label.description: A label for this MCP server, used to identify it in tool calls.

server_url.description: The URL for the MCP server.

type.description: The type of the MCP tool. Always mcp.

anyOf.description: A string array of allowed tool names
A filter object to specify which tools are allowed.

allowed_tools.description: List of allowed tool names or a filter object.

headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to send to the MCP server. Use for authentication or other purposes.

tool_names.description: List of tools that require approval.

always.description: A list of tools that always require approval.

tool_names.description: List of tools that do not require approval.

never.description: A list of tools that never require approval.

require_approval.description: Specify which of the MCP server's tools require approval.

anyOf.description: Give the model access to additional tools via remote Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers.

type.description: The type of the code interpreter tool. Always code_interpreter.

anyOf.description: A tool that runs Python code to help generate a response to a prompt.

type.description: The type of the local shell tool. Always local_shell.

anyOf.description: A tool that allows the model to execute shell commands in a local environment.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

parameters.description: A JSON schema object describing the parameters of the function.

strict.description: Whether to enforce strict parameter validation.

type.description: The type of the function tool. Always function.

description.description: A description of the function. Used by the model to determine whether or not to call the function.

anyOf.description: Defines a function in your own code the model can choose to call.

tools.description: An array of tools the model may call while generating a response. You can specify which tool to use by setting the tool_choice parameter.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

truncation.description:
The truncation strategy to use for the model response.

    - auto: If the context of this response and previous ones exceeds the model's context window size, the model will truncate the response to fit the context window by dropping input items in the middle of the conversation.
    - disabled (default): If a model response will exceed the context window size for a model, the request will fail with a 400 error.

display_height.description: The height of the computer display.

display_width.description: The width of the computer display.

environment.description: The type of computer environment to control.

type.description: The type of the computer use tool. Always computer_use_preview.

anyOf.description: A tool that controls a virtual computer.

server_label.description: A label for this MCP server, used to identify it in tool calls.

server_url.description: The URL for the MCP server.

type.description: The type of the MCP tool. Always mcp.

anyOf.description: A string array of allowed tool names
A filter object to specify which tools are allowed.

allowed_tools.description: List of allowed tool names or a filter object.

headers.description: Optional HTTP headers to send to the MCP server. Use for authentication or other purposes.

tool_names.description: List of tools that require approval.

always.description: A list of tools that always require approval.

tool_names.description: List of tools that do not require approval.

never.description: A list of tools that never require approval.

require_approval.description: Specify which of the MCP server's tools require approval.

anyOf.description: Give the model access to additional tools via remote Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers.

type.description: The type of the code interpreter tool. Always code_interpreter.

anyOf.description: A tool that runs Python code to help generate a response to a prompt.

type.description: The type of the local shell tool. Always local_shell.

anyOf.description: A tool that allows the model to execute shell commands in a local environment.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

parameters.description: A JSON schema object describing the parameters of the function.

strict.description: Whether to enforce strict parameter validation.

type.description: The type of the function tool. Always function.

description.description: A description of the function. Used by the model to determine whether or not to call the function.

frequency_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.

logit_bias.description:
Modify the likelihood of specified tokens appearing in the completion.
  
  Accepts a JSON object that maps tokens (specified by their token ID in the tokenizer) to an associated bias value from -100 to 100. Mathematically, the bias is added to the logits generated by the model prior to sampling. The exact effect will vary per model, but values between -1 and 1 should decrease or increase likelihood of selection; values like -100 or 100 should result in a ban or exclusive selection of the relevant token.

logprobs.description: Whether to return log probabilities of the output tokens or not. If True, returns the log probabilities of each output token returned in the content of message.

top_logprobs.description: An integer between 0 and 20 specifying the number of most likely tokens to return at each token position, each with an associated log probability. logprobs must be set to True if this parameter is used.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens that can be generated in the chat completion. This value can be used to control costs for text generated via API.

max_completion_tokens.description: An upper bound for the number of tokens that can be generated for a completion, including visible output tokens and reasoning tokens.

n.description: How many chat completion choices to generate for each input message. Note that you will be charged based on the number of generated tokens across all of the choices. Keep n as 1 to minimize costs.

type.description: The type of the predicted content you want to provide.

anyOf.description: The content used for a Predicted Output. This is often the text of a file you are regenerating with minor changes.

type.description: The type of the content part.

text.description: The text content.

anyOf.description: An array of content parts with a defined type. Supported options differ based on the model being used to generate the response. Can contain text inputs.

content.description: The content that should be matched when generating a model response. If generated tokens would match this content, the entire model response can be returned much more quickly.

prediction.description: Configuration for a Predicted Output, which can greatly improve response times when large parts of the model response are known ahead of time.

presence_penalty.description: Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.

seed.description: This feature is in Beta. If specified, our system will make a best effort to sample deterministically, such that repeated requests with the same seed and parameters should return the same result.

role.description: The role of the author of the message  in this case, the system.

type.description: The type of the content part.

text.description: The text content.

content.description: The contents of the system message.

name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role.

role.description: The role of the author of the message  in this case, the user

url.description: Either a URL of the image or the base64 encoded image data.

detail.description: Specifies the detail level of the image. Currently supports JPG/JPEG, PNG, GIF, and WEBP formats.

type.description: The type of the content part.

format.description: The format of the encoded audio data. Currently supports "wav" and "mp3".

type.description: The type of the content part.

file_data.description:
The file data, encoded in base64 and passed to the model as a string. Only PDF format is supported.
        - Maximum size per file: Up to 512 MB and up to 2 million tokens.
        - Maximum number of files: Up to 20 files can be attached to a single GPT application or Assistant. This limit applies throughout the application's lifetime.
        - Maximum total file storage per user: 10 GB.

filename.description: The file name specified by the user. This name can be used to reference the file when interacting with the model, especially if multiple files are uploaded.

content.description: The contents of the user message.

name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role.

role.description: The role of the author of the message  in this case, the tool.

content.description: The contents of the tool message.

tool_call_id.description: Tool call that this message is responding to.

name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role.

role.description: The role of the author of the message  in this case, the Assistant.

anyOf.description: The contents of the Assistant message.

refusal.description: The refusal message generated by the model.

type.description: The type of the content part.

anyOf.description: An array of content parts with a defined type. Can be one or more of type text, or exactly one of type refusal.

content.description: The contents of the Assistant message. Required unless tool_calls or function_call is specified.

id.description: The ID of the tool call.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only function is supported.

name.description: The name of the function to call.

arguments.description: The arguments to call the function with, as generated by the model in JSON format. Note that the model does not always generate valid JSON, and may hallucinate parameters not defined by your function schema. Validate the arguments in your code before calling your function.

function.description: The function that the model called.

tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

refusal.description: The refusal message by the Assistant.

id.description: Unique identifier for a previous audio response from the model.

audio.description: Data about a previous audio response from the model.

name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role.

content.description: The contents of the developer message.

role.description: The role of the author of the message  in this case, the developer.

name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role.

messages.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far. Depending on the model you use, different message types (modalities) are supported, like text, documents (txt, pdf), images, and audio.

stream.description: If set to True, the model response data will be streamed to the client as it is generated using server-sent events.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
  We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic. We generally recommend altering this or top_p but not both.

stop.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens. The returned text will not contain the stop sequence.

type.description: The type of the tool. Currently, only function is supported.

description.description: A description of what the function does, used by the model to choose when and how to call the function.

name.description: The name of the function to be called. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

additionalProperties.description: The parameters the functions accepts, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the function call. If set to True, the model will follow the exact schema defined in the parameters field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when strict is True.

tools.description: A list of tools the model may call. Currently, only functions are supported as a tool. Use this to provide a list of functions the model may generate JSON inputs for. A max of 128 functions are supported.

anyOf.description: none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message. auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. required means the model must call one or more tools.
Specifies a tool the model should use. Use to force the model to call a specific function.

tool_choice.description:
Controls which (if any) tool is called by the model. none means the model will not call any tool and instead generates a message. auto means the model can pick between generating a message or calling one or more tools. required means the model must call one or more tools. Specifying a particular tool via {"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}} forces the model to call that tool.
  none is the default when no tools are present. auto is the default if tools are present.

parallel_tool_calls.description: Whether to enable parallel function calling during tool use.

reasoning_effort.description: Constrains effort on reasoning for reasoning models. Currently supported values are low, medium, and high. Reducing reasoning effort can result in faster responses and fewer tokens used on reasoning in a response.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always text.

anyOf.description: Default response format. Used to generate text responses.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always json_object.

anyOf.description: An older method of generating JSON responses. Using json_schema is recommended for models that support it. Note that the model will not generate JSON without a system or user message instructing it to do so.

type.description: The type of response format being defined. Always json_schema.

name.description: The name of the response format. Must be a-z, A-Z, 0-9, or contain underscores and dashes, with a maximum length of 64.

schema.description: The schema for the response format, described as a JSON Schema object.

strict.description: Whether to enable strict schema adherence when generating the output. If set to True, the model will always follow the exact schema defined in the schema field. Only a subset of JSON Schema is supported when strict is True.

description.description: A description of what the response format is for, used by the model to determine how to respond in the format.

json_schema.description: JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.

anyOf.description: JSON Schema response format. Used to generate structured JSON responses.

response_format.description: An object specifying the format that the model must output.

format.description: Specifies the output audio format. Must be one of wav, mp3, flac, opus, or pcm16.

voice.description: The voice the model uses to respond. Supported voices are alloy, ash, ballad, coral, echo, fable, nova, onyx, sage, and shimmer.

audio.description: Parameters for audio output. Required when audio output is requested with modalities: ["audio"].

modalities.description:
Output types that you would like the model to generate. Most models are capable of generating text, which is the default:
  
  ["text"]
  
  The gpt-4o-audio-preview model can also be used to generate audio. To request that this model generate both text and audio responses, you can use:
  
  ["text", "audio"]

search_context_size.description: High level guidance for the amount of context window space to use for the search. One of low, medium, or high. medium is the default.

city.description: Free text input for the city of the user, e.g. San Francisco.

country.description: The two-letter ISO country code of the user, e.g. US.

region.description: Free text input for the region of the user, e.g. California.

timezone.description: The IANA timezone of the user, e.g. America/Los_Angeles.

approximate.description: Approximate location parameters for the search.

type.description: The type of location approximation. Always approximate.

user_location.description: Approximate location parameters for the search.
